channel.title: Website/server small question
channel.description:
Why would a website cause a communication link error between the mysql connector and the web server?
I have read tons of documentations about the error that the server is spitting out, but nothing it points at is giving me any hints to the server being incorrect.
I thought it might have been because I didn't add my ip to the remote sql list, but that didnt solve anything either.
I think it may be the web server, but I don't know what would cause it. Any ideas?

item.title: Website/server small question
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

You may need to contact your host to whitelist the IP/port.

Read full topic

item.title: Website/server small question
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

Broken Britain:

Is your webserver blocking your connection? Is it remote SQL you are trying to access?

Thats what I was asking.

I’m using CPanel and have already put my ip into the remote sql. Im running the server (eventually) from this pc.
Like I mentioned; I am pretty confident that I have the sql driver configured properly and I have read a bunch of documentations about this error but none of it explains if/why my web server may be denying the connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Website/server small question
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Is your webserver blocking your connection? Is it remote SQL you are trying to access?
